intro: Psychotria glauca, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic in shape, and have a glossy green appearance. Psychotria glauca is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
